info.name: CYBERSOURCE REST APIs
info.description:
CYBERSOURCE RESTAPIs - is the collection to test your REST clients and make sample REST API calls. It provides samples for all supported HTTP methods - 'POST,'GET','PUT','DELETE'.


UseCase based Documentation is available on https://developer.cybersource.com/api/developer-guides.html

CyberSource REST SDKs available in 6 popular languages

https://github.com/CyberSource?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=rest-samples&type=&language=

* JAVA
* CSharp
* Node
* PHP
* Python
* Ruby

item.name: Retrieve All Instrument Identifer Payment Instruments (Paginated)

item.description:
The Instrument Identifier token represents a unique card number(PAN) or bank account (echeck).
It can also be associated with a Network Token that can be used for payment transactions.

item.name: Customers

exec: if (responseCode.code === 201 || responseCode.code === 200) {    var responseData = JSON.parse(responseBody);       postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-customer-id", responseData.id);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-customer-etag", postman.getResponseHeader("ETag"));}

request.description:
This request sets an **existing** Customers Payment Instrument to be the Customers default.  
The default Payment Instrument will be used for a payment if only the Customer token Id is supplied.  
* A Customer Payment Instrument token can be created by calling: **POST */tms/v2/customers/{{tms-customer-id}}/payment-instruments***

This request sets an **existing** Customers Shipping Address to be the Customers default.  
The default Shipping Address will be used for a payment if only the Customer token Id is supplied.  
* A Customer Shipping Address token can be created by calling: **POST */tms/v2/customers/{{tms-customer-id}}/shipping-addresses***

item.description:
The Customer token can be linked to multiple Payment Instruments and Shipping Addresses.
With one Payment Instrument and Shipping Address designated as the default.
It stores merchant reference information for the Customer such as email and merchant defined data.

item.name: Customer Payment Instruments

exec: if (responseCode.code === 201 || responseCode.code === 200) {    var responseData = JSON.parse(responseBody);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-paymentinstrument-id",responseData.id);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-paymentinstrument-etag", postman.getResponseHeader("ETag"));}

request.description:
Include an existing TMS Customer & Instrument Identifier token id in the request.
* A Customer token can be created by calling: **POST */tms/v2/customers***
* An Instrument Identifier token can be created by calling: **POST */tms/v1/instrumentidentifiers***

request.description:
Include an existing TMS Customer & Instrument Identifier token id in the request.
* A Customer token can be created by calling: **POST */tms/v2/customers***
* An Instrument Identifier token can be created by calling: **POST */tms/v1/instrumentidentifiers***

request.description:
Include an existing TMS Customer & Instrument Identifier token id in the request.
* A Customer token can be created by calling: **POST */tms/v2/customers***
* An Instrument Identifier token can be created by calling: **POST */tms/v1/instrumentidentifiers***

item.description:
The Customer Payment Instrument token is linked to a Customer and an Instrument Identifier.
It stores additional information in relation to a card number(PAN) or bank account (echeck).

item.name: Customer Shipping Addresses

exec: if (responseCode.code === 201 || responseCode.code === 200) {    var responseData = JSON.parse(responseBody);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-shippingAddress-id", responseData.id);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-shippingAddress-etag", postman.getResponseHeader("ETag"));}

request.description:
Include an existing TMS Customer token id in the request URI.

exec: if (responseCode.code === 201 || responseCode.code === 200) {    var responseData = JSON.parse(responseBody);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-shippingAddress-id", responseData.id);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-shippingAddress-etag", postman.getResponseHeader("ETag"));}

request.description:
Include an existing TMS Customer token id in the request URI.
* A Customer token can be created by calling: **POST */tms/v2/customers***

item.description:
The Customer Shipping Address token is linked to a Customer.
It stores shipping information in relation to the Customer.

item.name: Payment Instruments (Standalone)

exec: if (responseCode.code === 201 || responseCode.code === 200) {    var responseData = JSON.parse(responseBody);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-paymentinstrument-id",responseData.id);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-paymentinstrument-etag", postman.getResponseHeader("ETag"));    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-instrumentIdentifier-id", responseData._embedded.instrumentIdentifier.id);}

request.description:
Include an existing TMS Instrument Identifier id in the request body.
* An Instrument Identifier token can be created by calling: **POST */tms/v1/instrumentidentifiers***

exec: if (responseCode.code === 201 || responseCode.code === 200) {    var responseData = JSON.parse(responseBody);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-paymentinstrument-id",responseData.id);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-paymentinstrument-etag", postman.getResponseHeader("ETag"));    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("tms-instrumentIdentifier-id", responseData._embedded.instrumentIdentifier.id);}

request.description:
Include an existing TMS Instrument Identifier id in the request body.
* An Instrument Identifier token can be created by calling: **POST */tms/v1/instrumentidentifiers***

item.description:
The stand-alone Payment Instrument token is linked to an Instrument Identifier.
It stores additional information in relation to a card number(PAN) or bank account (echeck).

item.name: Instrument Identifiers
item.description:
The Instrument Identifier token represents a unique card number(PAN) or bank account (echeck).
It can also be associated with a Network Token that can be used for payment transactions.

item.name: Customers
item.description:
The Customer token can be linked to multiple Payment Instruments and Shipping Addresses.
With one Payment Instrument and Shipping Address designated as the default.
It stores merchant reference information for the Customer such as email and merchant defined data.

item.name: Customer Payment Instruments
Standalone Credit With Customer Payment Instrument

item.description:
The Customer Payment Instrument token is linked to a Customer and an Instrument Identifier.
It stores additional information in relation to a card number(PAN) or bank account (echeck).

item.name: Payment Instruments (Standalone)
item.description:
The stand-alone Payment Instrument token is linked to an Instrument Identifier.
It stores additional information in relation to a card number(PAN) or bank account (echeck).

item.description: The legacy token is for merchants using the legacy tokenization product that are not yet on TMS.
